{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the documents, sodium nitroprusside is metabolized to form an active metabolite that acts on the activation of guanylate cyclase. Guanylate cyclase is activated by nitric oxide (NO) released from sodium nitroprusside, which increases intracellular production of cGMP. Therefore, the answer is C. Guanylate cyclase.", "answer_choice": "C"}
